overview: After completion of this subject, students will have the knowledge to acquire focused ultrasound views for basic assessment of the heart, lung, and abdomen in paediatrics and be able to write a focused ultrasound report. Students will have interpreted and written a report on 10 focused ultrasound studies of pathology relevant to paediatric practice. Students will have the knowledge to perform ultrasound guided peripheral venous and arterial catheterisation in paediatric patients.
ilo: Identify the key steps required to acquire the standard focused transthoracic echocardiography (TTE), lung and abdominal ultrasound views in paediatric patients.
Interpret and write a structured interpretive report for focused ultrasound images of the heart, lungs and abdomen in paediatric patients.
Identify the key steps required to perform ultrasound-guided peripheral venous and arterial catheterisation in paediatric patients.
Evaluate the requirements for training, competence, and certification in focused TTE, lung and abdominal ultrasound in paediatric patients.
generic_skills: Improved written skills and problem-solving skills

Prerequisites.content: Note: these can be taken concurrently (at the same time)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Adequate visual acuity is required to interpret clinical ultrasound. A student is expected to demonstrate sufficient visual acuity to perform the required range of skills, including reading ultrasound images from a computer monitor.

assessment.brief: Interpretation of 10 case studies assessed by structured questions pertaining to each case
